title: Definition of a Stem-and-Leaf Plot
text: A stem-and-leaf graph (also known as a stemplot) is used for exploratory data analysis. On the "leaf" side of the table, we will list out the final significant digit (the last digit important to the data set). All other digits go in the "stem" side of the table. For instance, $$23$$ has stem $$2$$ and leaf 3; $$5432$$ has stem $$543$$ and leaf 2; $$9.3$$ has stem $$9$$ and leaf $$3$$.

title: Identifying the Correct Stems
text: Now, think about what it means for a student to get a score in the 90s or $$100$$. What would be the correct stems to look at from the graph?

title: Identifying Number of Data Points
text: Each leaf represents one data point in the chart. For instance, since there are four leaves labeled $$4$$ in the $$9$$ stem, we know that four people got 94s on the exam.

title: Identifying Correct Data Points
text: How many data points are there total in the $$9$$ and $$10$$ stems?

subHints.title: Identifying Correct Data Points
subHints.text: How many leaves are there for the $$9$$ and $$10$$ stem? Specifically, how many numbers are there in total in the data set $$0$$, $$2$$, $$4$$, $$4$$, $$4$$, $$4$$, $$6$$, 0?

title: Definition of a Proportion
text: The definition of a proportion is a part of the whole. Knowing that the part we're specifying is $$8$$, we can now determine the size of the whole.

title: Determining Total Number of Overall Data Points
text: How many data points are there in total?

subHints.title: Determining Total Number of Overall Data Points
subHints.text: How many numbers are there in all the leaves?

title: Determine the Final Proportion
text: What is the part divided by the whole? In essence, what is the number of students who got an A (90 and above) over all the students in the data set?

title: Determine the Final Proportion
text: We know that $$8$$ people score $$90$$ or above, and there are $$31$$ people total. Therefore, the proportion is $$\frac{8}{31}$$.
